Google AppEngine RoadMap Update

I came across this updated Google AppEngine roadmap via Dare’s post, Google App Engine on the road to becoming useful for building real web applications.

  • Support for running scheduled tasks
  • Task queues for performing background processing
  • Ability to receive and process incoming email
  • Support for sending and receiving XMPP (Jabber) message

This could end up being very competitive with Azure and has definitely re-peaked my interest in AppEngine. Those are four very instrumental features for building great applications in today’s web world. I might need to start spending more time with python again.

Of course, some real dates from both Google and Microsoft would be very helpful. The blog post on AppEngine mentions a conference and May and 6 months. Meanwhile, Amazon just keeps bringing more functionality to market.

Posted on Feb 09, 2009 and tagged as appengine, google, azure, aws
